availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Lawrence (Eddyville, Ky, bricklayer, capt. 17th Ky Cav.)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, bricklayer and soldier. Logan County, Kentucky, native. Son of George W. Lawrence and Elizabeth McPhearson Lawrence. Married to Ophelia E. Lawrence. Father of Eliza E. Lawrence, Ophelia E. Lawrence, Mary Lawrence, and George H. Lawrence. Bricklayer in Eddyville, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from March 29, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 770.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 415.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0140.
